result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominique Heindl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
Pay the restitution of $333.98 by money order before the end of business today. (Money orders were given to the DA office by the Defendant - Restitution is paid).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominique Heindl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Dominique Heindl
Current: 2750 Lindbergh Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 12-07-2016)
Prior: 2748 Lindbergh Ave., Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Dominique Heindl in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:34 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

Atty Cousins states agreeement, Defendant will enter plea. 
State recommends a $100 fine plus costs and surcharges including DNA surcharge.
Defendant to pay up front restitution, has cash but State rqeeusts that she obtain money order before end of business day.

Atty Arendt concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1

Atty Arendt states this is a joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:
15CM-379:
Pay a fine of $100 plus costs
Pay DNA surcharge
60 days to pay or obtain an agreement with the clerk
Pay the restitution of $333.98 by money order before the end of business today

Defendant Dominique Heindl in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties. P/NG entered.
